alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 3:40AM MST until March 06 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOWFALL CONTINUES IN THE HIGH COUNTRY, AND A BAND OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOWFALL IS LIKELY OVER THE PALMER DIVIDE AND ELBERT AND LINCOLN COUNTIES THIS MORNING... .Snowfall will increase again this morning and continue through this evening. In the mountains, persistent moderate snowfall will continue to cause travel impacts, and brief periods of heavier snowfall are possible during the day. A band of moderate to heavy snowfall is likely over the Palmer Divide and adjacent plains of Elbert and Lincoln Counties this morning, which would affect I-70 and I-25. Snowfall will decrease tonight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches. * WHERE...Castle Rock, Limon, and Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.
